pros:
- Administration truly cares about their employees
- If you apply yourself, you'll go somewhere - creating career ladders & leadership development opportunities are a priority for management
- Uplifting, team-centered, (often even fun!) work culture & office environment
- Good work-life balance
- Excellent benefits
cons: - The “Negative Nellies” have been there for many years & it can be difficult to combat - or worse yet, absorb - their energy

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Rochester, NY
pros: Great pay, wonderful residents, hours available if you want them. Residents very thankful for any and all care
cons: Lack of orientation, lack of help, quick to put you on the floor totally alone-passing meds as a nurse after 2 days of watching med pass, poor communication. Lack of staff, Lack of compassion that we are in these residents homes, not given knowledge of how to access pertinent medical info of all residents if you are being left alone with them. very minimal training on computer systems. I could go on

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Rochester, NY
pros:
As many hours as you want
Benefits for full time staff
cons:
Poor management.
ADONs and Supervisors don’t do their jobs.
Staffing is horrible; very under staffed.
No RT at night and only one nurse per floor.
No emergency pay or bonuses.
No incentives.
Nurses do the jobs of 3 people and aren’t appreciated.
Full time is paid more than per diem even though per diem still doesn’t get benefits.
Low pay.
Union rep doesn’t do anything for nurses.
Very heavy caseload and poor communication on management end.

job_title: Volunteer Services Supervisor in Rochester, NY
cons: Larger than life expectations for the role

pros: Good Benefits, people work well together
cons: Doesn't pay well compared to local private nursing homes

review_title: It has been very eventful and rewarding with a lot of gratification and experience.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Rochester, NY
pros: Over the 20yrs I have develop a lot of friendships and got a lot of experience and knowledge . I also have learn about running  being a supervisor and running a floor.
cons: The spit shifs are very difficulty and the policies of nursing not having time off during holidays to spend with your family.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Rochester, NY
pros: Great learning experience.  Built great relationships with patients and their families
cons: Horrible pay, no room for advancement, ALWAYS short staffed, no appreciation shown.  Maxed out on raises less than nine years, but hire people and pay them more because they are so desperate.  most of the new staff are just their for a paycheck and could care less about their quality of care.

review_title: "Nice" Place to Gain Experience and Later Move onto Better Things
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Henrietta, NY
pros: You meet new people from different backgrounds and get to make a difference in other people's lives.
cons: The wage is low. Management is rude and expects a lot from their employees. I had a manager that was passive aggressive. She seemed nice at first when you meet her but in reality (after being hired) she turns out to be quite the opposite.

pros: Love to help people that are unable to do for theyselves  or have love  ones to help
cons: When you resident are very ill or passway.

pros: great teamwork, everyone is very supportive
